Message.Title: Yahoo's Mayer eyeing Facebook, Google with personalized web content
Message.Msg: Yahoo Inc. is targeting Facebook Inc. and Google Inc. users with a technology that will personalize people's Internet experiences, CEO Marissa Mayer told Bloomberg TV this week. Mayer said the company is working on a way to create "interest graphs" that show common "likes" among people, package it together and send it right to the person's mobile device.

Message.Title: Marissa Mayer Focused on "Interest Graph"
Message.Msg: Mayer said the company is working on a way to create "interest graphs" that show common "likes" among people, package it together and send it right to the person's mobile device. This is just one of the many updates Mayer has made to Yahoo (Nasdaq: YHOO) since taking over the company last July. Changes have included plans to hire smartphone and tablet-proficient engineers as well as acquisitions of mobile app Stamped, and this year, collections app Snip.it.

Message.Title: From Msft 10Q
Message.Msg: "OSDâ€™s operating loss was reduced by higher revenue and lower cost of revenue and sales and marketing expenses, offset in part by higher research and development expenses. Cost of revenue decreased $163 million, driven by lower traffic acquisition costs and Yahoo! reimbursement costs. Sales and marketing expenses decreased $71 million or 19%, due mainly to decreased advertising and corporate marketing activities. Research and development expenses increased $47 million or 8%, primarily reflecting higher headcount-related expenses." Seems to be saying YHOO will be reporting less search income. I sure hope the float has been reduced enough to offset that shortfall in operating income if, infact, there is a shortfall.

Topic.Title: stock movement

Message.Msg: unlike many of the mindless fools and the cheerleaders who seemingly know all, i am not that omniscient to know the value of the shares of this company. i trade options, anywhere from 20 to more than 100 per day, and i spread, and i minimize risk, i look at the charts, i look at volatility and the greeks, and buy undervalued and sell overvalued. a couple days ago it was clearly a buy when a gap was almost 100% filled-close enough for me. i watch order flow. bottom line is trading the technicals and the valuations of the derivative is far more fruitful than figuring worth. i do take long and short biases based on these factoids and others such as the overall market. with this company the micros are far more important than the market macros, but one cannot lose sight of the latter as 70% + of all stocks go the direction of the market. good luck. hope the stock goes in the direction that you want.

Topic.Title: YHOO willing to sell at $43+...MSFT are you interested or are you going Defunct?

Message.Msg: Cash machine? Say it has $25B in cash selling off everything including all of AG and Yahoo Japan. Forget that its offshore, forget repatriation and forget the share buyback for a second. At $43x1.2B is $51.6B. Minus out that $25B in cash leaves you with $26.6B. The Yahoo core's operating income was over $850M give or take.($450M add'l was their investment income which will be gone) Why would ANYONE pay $26.6B for an asset generating only $850M? IDK about you but I'm not in the mood to wait 30yrs to breakeven on something. Let's say that MSFT DOUBLES that operating income and still its 15.5yrs just to breakeven. If I used your $20B figure it'd be even worse(37yr and 18yrs to breakeven) Sure Yahoo is cash rich but what you're asking an astronomical premium on is not. Even a 10PE only makes it worth $8.5B so $33.5B(my $25B cash figure)/1.2B=$27.91. I honestly can't get anymore generous then that.
